Issue description: Ensure that the necessary form fields use the autocomplete attribute with a valid input.
HTML snippet: <input type="email" data-slot="input" class="file:text-foreground selection:bg-primary selection:text-primary-foreground dark:bg-input/30 flex h-9 w-full min-w-0 border text-base transition-[color,box-shadow] outline-none file:inline-flex file:h-7 file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 md:text-sm focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive bg-[#393E46] border-[#393E46] text-[#EEEEEE] placeholder:text-[#EEEEEE]/60 focus:border-[#00ADB5] focus:ring-[#00ADB5]/20 rounded-full py-3 px-6" placeholder="Enter your email address" required="" value="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix all of the following:
  Add autocomplete attribute to form fields with a valid value as per HTML specification : https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#autofill-detail-tokens. In "name" attribute of field, prefer to use standard autocomplete value since browsers use "name" to suggest autofill. For field with no standard autocomplete value (eg: College ID), prefer to use autocomplete="off".

Issue description: Ensure buttons have discernible text
HTML snippet: <button data-slot="button" class="inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive dark:hover:bg-accent/50 gap-1.5 has-[>
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have inner text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

Issue description: Ensure that input fields have labels and that placeholders are not the only method used to convey the name or purpose of a form element.
HTML snippet: <input data-slot="input" class="file:text-foreground selection:bg-primary selection:text-primary-foreground dark:bg-input/30 flex h-9 min-w-0 px-3 text-base outline-none file:inline-flex file:h-7 file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 md:text-sm focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive pl-10 pr-4 py-2 w-40 lg:w-48 bg-white border border-[#393E46]/20 focus:border-[#00ADB5] focus:ring-2 focus:ring-[#00ADB5]/20 text-[#222831] placeholder:text-[#393E46] rounded-full transition-all duration-200" placeholder="Search..." value="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix all of the following:
Always provide a proper visible label for form elements such as text fields, email inputs, and password fields. Do not rely solely on the placeholder attribute to convey the purpose. The placeholder attribute is intended to offer supplemental guidance or examples, not to act as a label. Since it disappears once the user starts typing, it provides no ongoing context, which can confuse screen reader users and impair accessibility.

Always provide a proper visible label for form elements such as text fields, email inputs, and password fields. Do not rely solely on the placeholder attribute to convey the purpose. The placeholder attribute is intended to offer supplemental guidance or examples, not to act as a label. Since it disappears once the user starts typing, it provides no ongoing context, which can confuse screen reader users and impair accessibility.

Issue description: Ensure the search is placed within a landmark region to make it easily discoverable by assistive technologies, such as screen readers.
HTML snippet: <input data-slot="input" class="file:text-foreground selection:bg-primary selection:text-primary-foreground dark:bg-input/30 flex h-9 min-w-0 px-3 text-base outline-none file:inline-flex file:h-7 file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 md:text-sm focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive pl-10 pr-4 py-2 w-40 lg:w-48 bg-white border border-[#393E46]/20 focus:border-[#00ADB5] focus:ring-2 focus:ring-[#00ADB5]/20 text-[#222831] placeholder:text-[#393E46] rounded-full transition-all duration-200" placeholder="Search..." value="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix all of the following:
Add a landmark (role="search") to the search functionality on the webpage. Eg: <div role="search"> or <form role="search">

Issue description: Ensure non-text elements, such as textboxes and checkboxes, meet the minimum 3:1 contrast ratio against surrounding colors
HTML snippet: <input type="email" data-slot="input" class="file:text-foreground selection:bg-primary selection:text-primary-foreground dark:bg-input/30 flex h-9 w-full min-w-0 border text-base transition-[color,box-shadow] outline-none file:inline-flex file:h-7 file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 md:text-sm focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive bg-[#393E46] border-[#393E46] text-[#EEEEEE] placeholder:text-[#EEEEEE]/60 focus:border-[#00ADB5] focus:ring-[#00ADB5]/20 rounded-full py-3 px-6" placeholder="Enter your email address" required="" value="" style="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
 Use sufficient contrast between non-text elements and their background to meet the 3:1 ratio.
Adjust background or border colors to improve contrast for elements like checkboxes, text fields, and icons.
Use high-contrast themes or provide a setting for users to enhance visibility.
Ensure focus indicators, hover states, and active UI elements maintain at least 3:1 contrast.

Issue description: Ensure that images have meaningful alt text that serves the same purpose as the image.
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
 Add meaningful alt text to images. Avoid generic phrases like "image," "img," "graph," or "pic" as they do not convey details about the image's content. If an image is purely decorative and does not provide meaningful information, add alt="" or role="presentation" to it. For instance, you can change the alt text for this image from "Summer Collection 2024" to our AI-powered suggestion of "Tropical scarf with sunglasses and leaf, evokes a breezy, vacation vibe."

Issue description: Ensure that an image that exists only for aesthetic purposes is not read by assistive technologies
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
 Add alt="" or role="presentation" to the image. In case of an svg, remove the <title> tag inside the svg, if it exists. Remove role="img" and add role="presentation".
